section.name: The Primitives Component
section.p: Apache Jakarta Commons Primitives provides a collection of types and utilities optimized for working with Java primitives (boolean, byte, char, double, float, int, long, short). Generally, the Commons-Primitives classes are smaller, faster and easier to work with than their purely Object based alternatives.

section.name: Status
section.p: The most recent stable release is version 1.0, released 5 November 2003. Binary and source distributions are available.
Daily builds and tarballs are available from http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-commons/nightly/commons-primitives/.

section.name: Overview
section.p: Currently Commons Primitives is primarily composed of implementations of the java.util collections adapted for the primitive types.

dd.p: Contains interfaces, base classes and concrete implementations for primitive collections.

dl.dd: The java.util.Collection interface adapted for the primitive type <Type>
The java.util.Iterator interface adapted for the primitive type <Type>
The java.util.List interface adapted for the primitive type <Type>
The java.util.ListIterator interface adapted for the primitive type <Type>
An abstract base for <Type>List implementations backed by random access data structures like arrays
Static utility methods for working with <Type>Collection instances

dd.p: Contains adapters between the Object-based and primitive collections.
Contains adapters that convert between I/O Streams/Readers and byte/char iterators.
